Package com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVMetadataRestController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVMetadataRestController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class TEVMetadataRestController
extends Object
    REST controller for working with the application's Metadata -- it's settings. Settings are kept on a blog-by-blog basis. Whenever a Metadata object is encountered that doesn't have a valid theme set, the default is applied; not having a theme is a fatal bug for the application, so extra care is taken to guard agaisnt that eventuality.
    Author:
    tiyb

    • Method Detail

      • getAllTypes

        @GetMapping("/types")
public List<String> getAllTypes()
        GET to return all Types stored in the system. This implementation is very hard-coded, because there are only a specific number of types actually supported by Tumblr. The POST_TYPES member is public, but this API is still useful for JavaScript uses.
        Returns:
        List of type strings

      • isValidType

        public static boolean isValidType​(String typeName,
                                  List<String> validTypeNames)
        Helper function to determine if a "type" is valid or not, per Tumblr/TEV list of types. Though it is only used within this class, it was made public just in case other code ever needs it.
        Parameters:
        typeName - Name of the type to be validated
        validTypeNames - List of all of the valid types in the system
        Returns:
        True/False

      • getAllMetadata

        @GetMapping("/metadata")
public List<Metadata> getAllMetadata()

        GET to return all metadata objects stored in the system, for all blogs.

        If there is no data in the database, a default object is returned based on Metadata#newDefaultMetadata().

        Returns:
        The Metadata object stored in the database, or an empty object if the table has no data.

      • getMetadataByID

        @GetMapping("/metadata/{id}")
public Metadata getMetadataByID​(@PathVariable("id")
                                Integer id)
        GET to return the metadata for a particular blog based on the Metadata ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the MD to return
        Returns:
        Metadata object containing the settings for the blog in question

      • markBlogAsDefault

        @PutMapping("/metadata/{id}/markAsDefault")
public Metadata markBlogAsDefault​(@PathVariable("id")
                                  Integer id)
        PUT to mark a blog as the default blog by setting isDefault to true for its MD, and false to all other MDs.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the Metadata objec to be marked as the default
        Returns:
        The updated Metadata object

      • getDefaultMetadata

        @GetMapping("/metadata/default")
public Metadata getDefaultMetadata()
        Gets the default Metadata object. If none is set as the default, the first is set as the default (and saved), then returned. If no MD exists at all, one is created and saved and returned.
        Returns:
        The default MD object

      • getMetadataForBlog

        @GetMapping("/metadata/byBlog/{blog}")
public Metadata getMetadataForBlog​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                   String blog)
        GET to return the Metadata for a given blog, by name
        Parameters:
        blog - Name of the blog in question
        Returns:
        Metadata for the blog

      • getMetadataForBlogOrDefault

        @GetMapping("/metadata/byBlog/{blog}/orDefault")
public Metadata getMetadataForBlogOrDefault​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                            String blog)
        Specialized method to return the Metadata for a given blog, or the default Metadata object (which is also inserted into the DB, with the given blog name), if it doesn't yet exist.
        Parameters:
        blog - Name of the blog to be returned
        Returns:
        Metadata for the blog, or the default MD object if it didn't originally exist

      • getStaticListData

        @GetMapping("/metadata/staticListData")
public StaticListData getStaticListData()
        GET to return static data used to populate drop-down lists, for the user to set things like preferred sort order, filters, etc.
        Returns:
        object containing the different lists of strings available

      • updateMetadata

        @PutMapping("/metadata/{id}")
public Metadata updateMetadata​(@PathVariable("id")
                               Integer id,
                               @RequestBody
                               Metadata metadataDetails)
        PUT to update metadata details in the database. Assertions have been added around ensuring proper themes are saved.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the MD being saved
        metadataDetails - The data to be updated in the DB
        Returns:
        The updated Metadata object

      • deleteMetadata

        @DeleteMapping("/metadata/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteMetadata​(@PathVariable("id")
                                                                 Integer id)
        Removes a Metadata object (and therefore the blog, and all of its settings) from the DB.
        1. Validates that the MD being deleted exists, and isn't the only MD in the system
        2. Removes all conversation messages / conversations
        3. Removes all posts
        4. Removes the Metadata itself
        5. Ensures there is at least one MD object left in the system marked as 'default' or marks the first one as default otherwise
        Parameters:
        id - Metadata to be removed
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the response details
